definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Transitive verb must be followed by an object.
sentences.chinese: 及物动词之后须带宾语。

sentences.english: Our technique also can be extended to verify intransitive noninterference smoothly.

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物动词可接反身代词作宾语。

sentences.english: "Run" is an intransitive verb. No object can be followed.
sentences.chinese: Run是不及物动词，后面不能带宾语。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs govern the accusative case in German.
sentences.chinese: 在德语中，许多及物动词左右着宾格。

sentences.english: Many verbs normally have an object. These verbs are called" transitive " verbs.
sentences.chinese: 许多动词通常要跟宾语，被称为作及物动词。

sentences.english: Some transitive verbs denoting STATE cannot be used in the passive.
sentences.chinese: 一些表状态的及物动词不使用被动语态。

sentences.english: These adjectives have related intransitive verbs.
sentences.chinese: 这些形容词有对应的及物动词。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun as object.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物动词可跟反身代词作宾语。

sentences.english: They're out to prove that Google can be an African verb.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这里是为证明谷歌可以成为非洲的及物动词。

sentences.english: Intransitive verbs do not have an object.
Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun as object.

sentences.english: Verbs that take object are called transitive verbs.
sentences.chinese: 带宾语的动词称为及物动词。

Intransitive verbs do not require an object .
